Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

This mix offers a dramatic flavour punch from tiny leaves. The Green Shiso is bright, minty-citrus with hints of cinnamon and anise. The Red Shiso is more robust, with deeper cinnamon and bitter notes, and a stunning anthocyanin-rich burgundy colour that acts as a natural dye. Both are harvested as delicate, coin-sized micro-leaves.

2. The Ultimate Umami Garnish

These micro-leaves are designed for maximum impact in minimalist applications.

  • Sushi & Sashimi: The classic use. A single green shiso leaf under a piece of sashimi or in a hand roll cleanses the palate and complements the fish perfectly. Red shiso is traditionally used to colour and flavour umeboshi (pickled plums).
  • Salads & Garnishes: A handful scattered over a salad, ceviche, or cold noodle dishes adds an unforgettable, complex aroma and a burst of colour.
  • Cocktails & Infusions: Used as an aromatic garnish for cocktails or infused into vinegar, soy sauce, or salt to impart their unique flavour profile.
3. The Harvest and Yield

Grown as a cut-and-come-again micro-green, the mix is harvested with scissors just above the soil line when the first true leaves appear. Supplied as a dedicated RFID seed pad, it provides multiple dense harvests of 20â€“30g of mixed micro-shiso from a single bay over a 2-3 week period.
